content.content:
CREATE TABLE Examination
(
    ID                 INTEGER          null,
    `Examination Date` DATE         null,
    `aCL IgG`          REAL        null,
    `aCL IgM`          REAL        null,
    ANA                INTEGER          null,
    `ANA Pattern`      TEXT null,
    `aCL IgA`          INTEGER          null,
    Diagnosis          TEXT null,
    KCT                TEXT null,
    RVVT              TEXT null,
    LAC                TEXT null,
    Symptoms           TEXT null,
    Thrombosis         INTEGER          null,
    foreign key (ID) references Patient (ID)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);
CREATE TABLE Patient
(
    ID           INTEGER default 0 not null
        primary key,
    SEX          TEXT  null,
    Birthday     DATE          null,
    Description  DATE          null,
    `First Date` DATE          null,
    Admission    TEXT  null,
    Diagnosis    TEXT  null
);
CREATE TABLE Laboratory
(
    ID        INTEGER  default 0            not null,
    Date      DATE default '0000-00-00' not null,
    GOT       INTEGER                       null,
    GPT       INTEGER                        null,
    LDH       INTEGER                        null,
    ALP       INTEGER                        null,

    `T-CHO`   INTEGER                       null,

    WBC       REAL             null,
    RBC       REAL             null,

    HCT       REAL             null,

content.text: Now I can see the schema. The claim is about a patient with abnormal LDH (≥ 500) and their 'First Date'. Let me query for patients with LDH >= 500 and their First Date.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT DISTINCT P.ID, P.[First Date] FROM Patient P INNER JOIN Laboratory L ON P.ID = L.ID WHERE L.LDH >= 500;"
input.description: Find patients with abnormal LDH and their First Date

content.text: There are many patients with abnormal LDH. The claim says "the patient" (singular), implying there's exactly one. But the hint says "latest patient refers to ID with MAX('First Date')". The claim says "the patient with an abnormal lactate dehydrogenase level" - it likely refers to the one with the latest First Date. Let me check which patient has the maximum First Date among those with LDH >= 500.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/thrombosis_prediction.sqlite" "SELECT P.ID, P.[First Date] FROM Patient P INNER JOIN Laboratory L ON P.ID = L.ID WHERE L.LDH >= 500 AND P.[First Date] IS NOT NULL AND P.[First Date] != '' GROUP BY P.ID ORDER BY P.[First Date] DESC LIMIT 5;"

content.text:
The patient with the maximum (latest) First Date among those with abnormal LDH (≥ 500) is patient 1137040, with a First Date of **1998-07-01**.

This matches the claim exactly.
